basics.name: Tom Dooner
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a software engineer working on projects to improve the way Americans interact with government.

work.summary: A unique nine-month working experience on a two-person team to design and build a product from scratch for Multnomah County (Portland, OR). We tackled the problem of helping crime victims get access to resources and support at any stage of the justice system.
highlights: We created Case Companion, an application that integrates data from the state prison system, local probation system, and the District Attorney's office and presents it to users in a trauma-informed and contextual way.
Designed and began implementation of a proactive messaging campaign so crime victims would always know who they could call and what would come next for their case in the justice system.

work.summary: Brigade connects voters with each other as a platform for opinion expression, taking action, and holding elected officials accountable. Working at a growing company like Brigade afforded me a lot of opportunity to contribute to many parts of the stack, depending on whatever the company needed at the time.
highlights: Near the beginning of Brigade, I was part of the Ops team which deployed and maintained the initial infrastructure with automation tools like Chef and Terraform.
I led the deployment of a microservices architecture (using Apache Mesos) to allow developers to quickly deploy high-performance applications
As the infrastructure stabilized, I moved to the API team to build various features into our REST API built with Rails.
I later moved to the Web team to build user-facing product features in our React codebase.

work.summary: I developed new features for Causes, a Rails app dedicated to giving people an online place to fight for what they believe in. Causes was acquired by Brigade in June 2014.

volunteer.summary: I have been working on the OpenDisclosure team. We're building a website which tracks and visualizes campaign finance contributions at the local level.
